MPROT5.description: Master 5 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control.

MPROT3.description: Master 3 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control.

MPROT2.description: Master 2 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control

MPROT1.description: Master 1 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control

MPROT0.description: Master 0 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control

PWD_ZCD.description: power down the zero cross detection function for discontinuous conductor mode

DISABLE_AUTO_CLK_SWITCH.description: Disable automatic clock switch from internal osc to xtal clock.

SEL_CLK.description: select 24 MHz Crystal clock for DCDC, when dcdc_disable_auto_clk_switch is set.

PWD_OSC_INT.description: Power down internal osc. Only set this bit, when 24 MHz crystal osc is available

PWD_CUR_SNS_CMP.description: The power down signal of the current detector.

CUR_SNS_THRSH.description: Set the threshold of current detector, if the peak current of the inductor exceeds the threshold, the current detector will assert

OVERCUR_TRIG_ADJ.description: The threshold of over current detection in run mode and power save mode: run mode power save mode 0x0 1 A 0

PWD_CMP_BATT_DET.description: set to "1" to power down the low voltage detection comparator

EN_LP_OVERLOAD_SNS.description: enable the overload detection in power save mode, if current is larger than the overloading threshold (typical value is 50 mA), DCDC will switch to the run mode automatically

LP_OVERLOAD_THRSH.description: the threshold of the counting number of charging times during the period that lp_overload_freq_sel sets in power save mode

LP_OVERLOAD_FREQ_SEL.description: the period of counting the charging times in power save mode 0: eight 32k cycle 1: sixteen 32k cycle

LP_HIGH_HYS.description: Adjust hysteretic value in low power from 12.5mV to 25mV

XTALOK_DISABLE.description: 1'b1: Disable xtalok detection circuit 1'b0: Enable xtalok detection circuit

XTAL_24M_OK.description: set to 1 to switch internal ring osc to xtal 24M

STS_DC_OK.description: Status register to indicate DCDC status. 1'b1: DCDC already settled 1'b0: DCDC is settling

REG_FBK_SEL.description: select the feedback point of the internal regulator

REG_RLOAD_SW.description: control the load resistor of the internal regulator of DCDC, the load resistor is connected as default "1", and need set to "0" to disconnect the load resistor

LP_CMP_ISRC_SEL.description: set the current bias of low power comparator 0x0: 50 nA 0x1: 100 nA 0x2: 200 nA 0x3: 400 nA

LOOPCTRL_HST_THRESH.description: increase the threshold detection for common mode analog comparator

LOOPCTRL_EN_HYST.description: Enable hysteresis in switching converter common mode analog comparators

LOOPCTRL_DC_C.description: Ratio of integral control parameter to proportional control parameter in the switching DC-DC converter, and can be used to optimize efficiency and loop response

LOOPCTRL_DC_R.description: Magnitude of proportional control parameter in the switching DC-DC converter control loop.

LOOPCTRL_DC_FF.description: Two's complement feed forward step in duty cycle in the switching DC-DC converter

LOOPCTRL_EN_RCSCALE.description: Enable analog circuit of DC-DC converter to respond faster under transient load conditions.

LOOPCTRL_RCSCALE_THRSH.description: Increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.

LOOPCTRL_HYST_SIGN.description: Invert the sign of the hysteresis in DC-DC analog comparators.

BATTMONITOR_EN_BATADJ.description: This bit enables the DC-DC to improve efficiency and minimize ripple using the information from the BATT_VAL field

DISABLE_PULSE_SKIP.description: Set to "0" : stop charging if the duty cycle is lower than what set by dcdc_neglimit_in

DCM_SET_CTRL.description: Set high to improve the transition from heavy load to light load

TRG.description: Target value of VDD_SOC, 25 mV each step 0x0: 0.8V 0xE: 1.15V 0x1F:1.575V

TARGET_LP.description: Target value of standby (low power) mode 0x0: 0

MINPWR_DC_HALFCLK.description: Set DCDC clock to half freqeuncy for continuous mode

MISC_DELAY_TIMING.description: Ajust delay to reduce ground noise

DISABLE_STEP.description: Disable stepping for the output VDD_SOC of DCDC

DONE0_1_IRQ.description: ETC DONE0 and DONE1 IRQ State Register

DONE2_ERR_IRQ.description: ETC DONE_2 and DONE_ERR IRQ State Register

EXT0_TRIG_ENABLE.description: TSC0 TRIG enable register. 1'b1: enable external TSC0 trigger. 1'b0: disable external TSC0 trigger.

EXT0_TRIG_PRIORITY.description: External TSC0 trigger priority, 7 is Highest, 0 is lowest .

EXT1_TRIG_ENABLE.description: TSC1 TRIG enable register. 1'b1: enable external TSC1 trigger. 1'b0: disable external TSC1 trigger.

EXT1_TRIG_PRIORITY.description: External TSC1 trigger priority, 7 is Highest, 0 is lowest .

PRE_DIVIDER.description: Pre-divider for trig delay and interval .

DMA_MODE_SEL.description: 1'b0: Trig DMA_REQ with latched signal, REQ will be cleared when ACK and source request cleared

TSC_BYPASS.description: 1'b1: TSC is bypassed to ADC2. 1'b0: TSC not bypassed. To use ADC2, this bit should be cleared.

SOFTRST.description: Software reset, high active. When write 1 ,all logical will be reset.

TRIG0_ENABLE.description: When TRIG0 done enable DMA request

TRIG1_ENABLE.description: When TRIG1 done enable DMA request

TRIG2_ENABLE.description: When TRIG2 done enable DMA request

TRIG_MODE.description: TRIG mode register. 1'b0: hardware trigger. 1'b1: software trigger.

TRIG_CHAIN.description: TRIG chain length to the ADC. 0: Trig length is 1; ... 7: Trig length is 8;

TRIG_PRIORITY.description: External trigger priority, 7 is highest, 0 is lowest .

SYNC_MODE.description: TRIG mode control . 1'b0: Disable sync mode; 1'b1: Enable sync mode

CHAINx_DONE.description: CHAINx done interrupt detection bit 0: CHAIN0 done interrupt bit 1: CHAIN1 done interrupt bit 2: CHAIN2 done interrupt bit 3: CHAIN3 done interrupt bit 4: CHAIN4 done interrupt bit 5: CHAIN5 done interrupt bit 6: CHAIN6 done interrupt bit 7: CHAIN7 done interrupt The done interrupts are cleared by writing a logic 1 to the bits

IE0.description: CHAIN0 IE 2'b00: Finished Interrupt on Done0 2'b01: Finished Interrupt on Done1 2'b10: Finished Interrupt on Done2 2'b11: Finished Interrupt on Done3

EDGE0.description: Active edge for edge detection on XBAR_OUT0

EDGE1.description: Active edge for edge detection on XBAR_OUT1

EDGE2.description: Active edge for edge detection on XBAR_OUT2

EDGE3.description: Active edge for edge detection on XBAR_OUT3

RXCLKSRC.description: Sample Clock source selection for Flash Reading

ARDFEN.description: Enable AHB bus Read Access to IP RX FIFO.

ATDFEN.description: Enable AHB bus Write Access to IP TX FIFO.

SERCLKDIV.description: The serial root clock could be divided inside FlexSPI . Refer Clocks chapter for more details on clocking.

HSEN.description: Half Speed Serial Flash access Enable.

COMBINATIONEN.description: This bit is to support Flash Octal mode access by combining Port A and B Data pins (A_DATA[3:0] and B_DATA[3:0]).

SCKFREERUNEN.description: This bit is used to force SCLK output free-running. For FPGA applications, external device may use SCLK as reference clock to its internal PLL. If SCLK free-running is enabled, data sampling with loopback clock from SCLK pad is not supported (MCR0[RXCLKSRC]=2).

IPGRANTWAIT.description: Time out wait cycle for IP command grant.

AHBGRANTWAIT.description: Timeout wait cycle for AHB command grant.

AHBBUSWAIT.description: AHB Read/Write access to Serial Flash Memory space will timeout if not data received from Flash or data not transmitted after AHBBUSWAIT * 1024 ahb clock cycles, AHB Bus will get an error response

SEQWAIT.description: Command Sequence Execution will timeout and abort after SEQWAIT * 1024 Serial Root Clock cycles

CLRAHBBUFOPT.description: This bit determines whether AHB RX Buffer and AHB TX Buffer will be cleaned automatically when FlexSPI returns STOP mode ACK. Software should set this bit if AHB RX Buffer or AHB TX Buffer will be powered off in STOP mode. Otherwise AHB read access after exiting STOP mode may hit AHB RX Buffer or AHB TX Buffer but their data entries are invalid.

CLRLEARNPHASE.description: The sampling clock phase selection will be reset to phase 0 when this bit is written with 0x1. This bit will be auto-cleared immediately.

SAMEDEVICEEN.description: All external devices are same devices (both in types and size) for A1/A2/B1/B2.

SCKBDIFFOPT.description: B_SCLK pad can be used as A_SCLK differential clock output (inverted clock to A_SCLK). In this case, port B flash access is not available. After changing the value of this field, MCR0[SWRESET] should be set.

RESUMEWAIT.description: Wait cycle (in AHB clock cycle) for idle state before suspended command sequence resumed.

APAREN.description: Parallel mode enabled for AHB triggered Command (both read and write) .

CLRAHBRXBUF.description: Clear the status/pointers of AHB RX Buffer. Auto-cleared.

CLRAHBTXBUF.description: Clear the status/pointers of AHB TX Buffer. Auto-cleared.

CACHABLEEN.description: Enable AHB bus cachable read access support.

BUFFERABLEEN.description: Enable AHB bus bufferable write access support. This field affects the last beat of AHB write access, refer for more details about AHB bufferable write.

READADDROPT.description: AHB Read Address option bit. This option bit is intend to remove AHB burst start address alignment limitation.

IPCMDDONEEN.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Execution finished interrupt enable.

IPCMDGEEN.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt enable.

AHBCMDGEEN.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt enable.

IPCMDERREN.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt enable.

AHBCMDERREN.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt enable.

IPRXWAEN.description: IP RX FIFO WaterMark available interrupt enable.

IPTXWEEN.description: IP TX FIFO WaterMark empty interrupt enable.

SCKSTOPBYRDEN.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async RX FIFO full interrupt enable.

SCKSTOPBYWREN.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async TX FIFO empty interrupt enable.

AHBBUSERROREN.description: AHB Bus error interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

SEQTIMEOUTEN.description: Sequence execution timeout interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

KEYDONEEN.description: OTFAD key blob processing done interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

KEYERROREN.description: OTFAD key blob processing error interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

IPCMDDONE.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Execution finished interrupt. This interrupt is also generated when there is IPCMDGE or IPCMDERR interrupt generated.

IPCMDGE.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt.

AHBCMDGE.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt.

IPCMDERR.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt. When an error detected for IP command, this command will be ignored and not executed at all.

AHBCMDERR.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt. When an error detected for AHB command, this command will be ignored and not executed at all.

IPRXWA.description: IP RX FIFO watermark available interrupt.

IPTXWE.description: IP TX FIFO watermark empty interrupt.

SCKSTOPBYRD.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async RX FIFO full interrupt.

SCKSTOPBYWR.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async TX FIFO empty interrupt.

AHBBUSERROR.description: AHB Bus timeout or AHB bus illegal access Flash during OTFAD key blob processing interrupt.

KEYDONE.description: OTFAD key blob processing done interrupt.

KEYERROR.description: OTFAD key blob processing error interrupt.

KEY.description: The Key to lock or unlock LUT.

LOCK.description: Lock LUT

BUFSZ.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

MSTRID.description: This AHB RX Buffer is assigned according to AHB Master with ID (MSTR_ID).

PRIORITY.description: This priority for AHB Master Read which this AHB RX Buffer is assigned. 7 is the highest priority, 0 the lowest.

PREFETCHEN.description: AHB Read Prefetch Enable for current AHB RX Buffer corresponding Master.

BUFSZ.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

MSTRID.description: This AHB RX Buffer is assigned according to AHB Master with ID (MSTR_ID).

PRIORITY.description: This priority for AHB Master Read which this AHB RX Buffer is assigned. 7 is the highest priority, 0 the lowest.

PREFETCHEN.description: AHB Read Prefetch Enable for current AHB RX Buffer corresponding Master.

CSINTERVAL.description: This field is used to set the minimum interval between flash device Chip selection deassertion and flash device Chip selection assertion. If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

ARDSEQID.description: Sequence Index for AHB Read triggered Command in LUT.

ARDSEQNUM.description: Sequence Number for AHB Read triggered Command in LUT.

AWRSEQID.description: Sequence Index for AHB Write triggered Command.

AWRSEQNUM.description: Sequence Number for AHB Write triggered Command.

AWRWAIT.description: For certain devices (such as FPGA), it need some time to write data into internal memory after the command sequences finished on FlexSPI interface

CLRINSTRPTR.description: Clear the instruction pointer which is internally saved pointer by JMP_ON_CS. Refer Programmable Sequence Engine for details.

WMOPT1.description: Write mask option bit 1. This option bit could be used to remove AHB write burst start address alignment limitation.

WMENA.description: Write mask enable bit for flash device on port A. When write mask function is needed for memory device on port A, this bit must be set.

WMENB.description: Write mask enable bit for flash device on port B. When write mask function is needed for memory device on port B, this bit must be set.

SFAR.description: Serial Flash Address for IP command.

IDATSZ.description: Flash Read/Program Data Size (in Bytes) for IP command.

ISEQID.description: Sequence Index in LUT for IP command.

ISEQNUM.description: Sequence Number for IP command: ISEQNUM+1.

IPAREN.description: Parallel mode Enabled for IP command.

TRG.description: Setting this bit will trigger an IP Command.

CLRIPRXF.description: Clear all valid data entries in IP RX FIFO.

RXDMAEN.description: IP RX FIFO reading by DMA enabled.

CLRIPTXF.description: Clear all valid data entries in IP TX FIFO.

TXDMAEN.description: IP TX FIFO filling by DMA enabled.

DLLRESET.description: Software could force a reset on DLL by setting this field to 0x1. This will cause the DLL to lose lock and re-calibrate to detect an ref_clock half period phase shift. The reset action is edge triggered, so software need to clear this bit after set this bit (no delay limitation).

SLVDLYTARGET.description: The delay target for slave delay line is: ((SLVDLYTARGET+1) * 1/32 * clock cycle of reference clock (serial root clock). If serial root clock is >= 100 MHz, DLLEN set to 0x1, OVRDEN set to =0x0, then SLVDLYTARGET setting of 0xF is recommended.

OVRDEN.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override enable.

OVRDVAL.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override value.

SEQIDLE.description: This status bit indicates the state machine in SEQ_CTL is idle and there is command sequence executing on FlexSPI interface.

ARBIDLE.description: This status bit indicates the state machine in ARB_CTL is busy and there is command sequence granted by arbitrator and not finished yet on FlexSPI interface. When ARB_CTL state (ARBIDLE=0x1) is idle, there will be no transaction on FlexSPI interface also (SEQIDLE=0x1). So this bit should be polled to wait for FlexSPI controller become idle instead of SEQIDLE.

ARBCMDSRC.description: This status field indicates the trigger source of current command sequence granted by arbitrator. This field value is meaningless when ARB_CTL is not busy (STS0[ARBIDLE]=0x1).

AHBCMDERRID.description: Indicates the sequence index when an AHB command error is detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[AHBCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

AHBCMDERRCODE.description: Indicates the Error Code when AHB command Error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[AHBCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

IPCMDERRID.description: Indicates the sequence Index when IP command error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[IPCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

IPCMDERRCODE.description: Indicates the Error Code when IP command Error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[IPCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

ASLVLOCK.description: Flash A sample clock slave delay line locked.

AREFLOCK.description: Flash A sample clock reference delay line locked.

ASLVSEL.description: Flash A sample clock slave delay line delay cell number selection .

AREFSEL.description: Flash A sample clock reference delay line delay cell number selection.

BSLVLOCK.description: Flash B sample clock slave delay line locked.

BREFLOCK.description: Flash B sample clock reference delay line locked.

BSLVSEL.description: Flash B sample clock slave delay line delay cell number selection.

BREFSEL.description: Flash B sample clock reference delay line delay cell number selection.

ACTIVE.description: Indicates if an AHB read prefetch command sequence has been suspended.

BUFID.description: AHB RX BUF ID for suspended command sequence.

DATLFT.description: Left Data size for suspended command sequence (in byte).

FILL.description: Fill level of IP RX FIFO.

RDCNTR.description: Total Read Data Counter: RDCNTR * 64 Bits.

FILL.description: Fill level of IP TX FIFO.

WRCNTR.description: Total Write Data Counter: WRCNTR * 64 Bits.

DTCM_MAM_STAT_EN.description: DTCM Magic Address Match Status Enable

OCRAM_MAM_STAT_EN.description: OCRAM Magic Address Match Status Enable

ITCM_MAM_SIG_EN.description: ITCM Magic Address Match Interrupt Enable

DTCM_MAM_SIG_EN.description: DTCM Magic Address Match Interrupt Enable

OCRAM_MAM_SIG_EN.description: OCRAM Magic Address Match Interrupt Enable

SRE.description: software reset extension, an option way to generate software reset

CMD32EN.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (otherwise 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

CNTLOW.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

CNTHIGH.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

TOVALLOW.description: Low byte of the timeout value

TOVALHIGH.description: High byte of the timeout value

SCR1C.description: Statistical Check Run Length 1 Count Register

SCR1L.description: Statistical Check Run Length 1 Limit Register

SCR2C.description: Statistical Check Run Length 2 Count Register

PKRCNTFE.description: Statistical Check Poker Count F and E Register

UNUSED4.description: This bit is unused. Always reads zero.

UNUSED5.description: This bit is unused. Always reads zero.

FCT_VAL.description: Read only: Frequency Count Valid. Indicates that a valid frequency count may be read from FRQCNT.

TST_OUT.description: Read only: Test point inside ring oscillator.

LRUN_CONT.description: Long run count continues between entropy generations

TF1BR0.description: Test Fail, 1-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF1BR0=1, the 1-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF1BR1.description: Test Fail, 1-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF1BR1=1, the 1-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF2BR0.description: Test Fail, 2-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF2BR0=1, the 2-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF2BR1.description: Test Fail, 2-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF2BR1=1, the 2-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF3BR0.description: Test Fail, 3-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF3BR0=1, the 3-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF3BR1.description: Test Fail, 3-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF3BR1=1, the 3-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF4BR0.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF4BR0=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF4BR1.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF4BR1=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF5BR0.description: Test Fail, 5-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF5BR0=1, the 5-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

TF5BR1.description: Test Fail, 5-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF5BR1=1, the 5-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

TF6PBR0.description: Test Fail, 6 Plus Bit Run, Sampling 0s

TF6PBR1.description: Test Fail, 6 Plus Bit Run, Sampling 1s

TFSB.description: Test Fail, Sparse Bit. If TFSB=1, the Sparse Bit Test has failed.

TFLR.description: Test Fail, Long Run. If TFLR=1, the Long Run Test has failed.

TFP.description: Test Fail, Poker. If TFP=1, the Poker Test has failed.

TFMB.description: Test Fail, Mono Bit. If TFMB=1, the Mono Bit Test has failed.

NO_PRGM.description: If set, the TRNG registers cannot be programmed

HW_ERR.description: Bit position that can be cleared if corresponding bit of INT_STATUS register has been asserted.

ENT_VAL.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

FRQ_CT_FAIL.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

HW_ERR.description: Bit position that can be cleared if corresponding bit of INT_STATUS has been asserted.

ENT_VAL.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

FRQ_CT_FAIL.description: Same behavior as bit 0 of this register.

MIN_REV.description: Shows the IP's Minor revision of the TRNG.

MAJ_REV.description: Shows the IP's Major revision of the TRNG.

CONFIG_OPT.description: Shows the IP's Configuaration options for the TRNG.

ECO_REV.description: Shows the IP's ECO revision of the TRNG.

INTG_OPT.description: Shows the integration options for the TRNG.

ERA.description: Shows the compile options for the TRNG.

HPHACIVR.description: SNVS_HP High Assurance Counter IV Register

HPRTCMR.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter MSB Register

HPRTCLR.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter LSB Register

LPSRTCMR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter MSB Register

LPSRTCLR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter LSB Register

LPSMCMR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter MSB Register

LPSMCLR.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter LSB Register

ZMK_WSL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and the ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

ZMK_RSL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Soft Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK Registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

SRTC_SL.description: Secure Real Time Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC Registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

LPCALB_SL.description: LP Calibration Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

MC_SL.description: Monotonic Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

GPR_SL.description: General Purpose Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

LPSVCR_SL.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

LPTDCR_SL.description: LP Tamper Detectors Configuration Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPTDCR

MKS_SL.description: Master Key Select Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LPMKCR

HPSVCR_L.description: HP Security Violation Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSVCR

HPSICR_L.description: HP Security Interrupt Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSICR

HAC_L.description: High Assurance Counter Lock When set, prevents any writes to HPHACIVR, HPHACR, and HAC_EN bit of HPCOMR

SSM_ST.description: SSM State Transition Transition state of the system security monitor

SSM_ST_DIS.description: SSM Secure to Trusted State Transition Disable When set, disables the SSM transition from secure to trusted state

SSM_SFNS_DIS.description: SSM Soft Fail to Non-Secure State Transition Disable When set, it disables the SSM transition from soft fail to non-secure state

LP_SWR.description: LP Software Reset When set to 1, most registers in the SNVS_LP section are reset, but the following registers are not reset by an LP software reset: Secure Real Time Counter Time Alarm Register This bit cannot be set when the LP_SWR_DIS bit is set

LP_SWR_DIS.description: LP Software Reset Disable When set, disables the LP software reset

SW_SV.description: Software Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a non-fatal security violation

SW_FSV.description: Software Fatal Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a fatal security violation

SW_LPSV.description: LP Software Security Violation When set, SNVS_LP treats this bit as a security violation

PROG_ZMK.description: Program Zeroizable Master Key This bit activates ZMK hardware programming mechanism

MKS_EN.description: Master Key Select Enable When not set, the one time programmable (OTP) master key is selected by default

HAC_EN.description: High Assurance Counter Enable This bit controls the SSM transition from the soft fail to the hard fail state

HAC_LOAD.description: High Assurance Counter Load When set, it loads the High Assurance Counter Register with the value of the High Assurance Counter Load Register

HAC_CLEAR.description: High Assurance Counter Clear When set, it clears the High Assurance Counter Register

HAC_STOP.description: High Assurance Counter Stop This bit can be set only when SSM is in soft fail state

NPSWA_EN.description: Non-Privileged Software Access Enable When set, allows non-privileged software to access all SNVS registers, including those that are privileged software read/write access only

HPTA_EN.description: HP Time Alarm Enable When set, the time alarm interrupt is generated if the value in the HP Time Alarm Registers is equal to the value of the HP Real Time Counter

DIS_PI.description: Disable periodic interrupt in the functional interrupt

PI_EN.description: HP Periodic Interrupt Enable The periodic interrupt can be generated only if the HP Real Time Counter is enabled

PI_FREQ.description: Periodic Interrupt Frequency Defines frequency of the periodic interrupt

HPCALB_EN.description: HP Real Time Counter Calibration Enabled Indicates that the time calibration mechanism is enabled.

HPCALB_VAL.description: HP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for the HP Real Time Counter

SV0_EN.description: Security Violation 0 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 0 security violation

SV1_EN.description: Security Violation 1 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 1 security violation

SV2_EN.description: Security Violation 2 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 2 security violation

SV3_EN.description: Security Violation 3 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 3 security violation

SV4_EN.description: Security Violation 4 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 4 security violation

SV5_EN.description: Security Violation 5 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 5 security violation

LPSVI_EN.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt Enable This bit enables generating of the security interrupt to the host processor upon security violation signal from the LP section

SV0_CFG.description: Security Violation 0 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 0 Security Violation Input

SV1_CFG.description: Security Violation 1 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 1 Security Violation Input

SV2_CFG.description: Security Violation 2 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 2 Security Violation Input

SV3_CFG.description: Security Violation 3 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 3 Security Violation Input

SV4_CFG.description: Security Violation 4 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 4 Security Violation Input

SV5_CFG.description: Security Violation 5 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 5 Security Violation Input

LPSV_CFG.description: LP Security Violation Configuration This field configures the LP security violation source.

HPTA.description: HP Time Alarm Indicates that the HP Time Alarm has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

PI.description: Periodic Interrupt Indicates that periodic interrupt has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

LPDIS.description: Low Power Disable If 1, the low power section has been disabled by means of an input signal to SNVS

BTN.description: Button Value of the BTN input

BI.description: Button Interrupt Signal ipi_snvs_btn_int_b was asserted.

SSM_STATE.description: System Security Monitor State This field contains the encoded state of the SSM's state machine

SECURITY_CONFIG.description: Security Configuration This field reflects the settings of the sys_secure_boot input and the three security configuration inputs to SNVS

OTPMK_SYNDROME.description: One Time Programmable Master Key Syndrome In the case of a single-bit error, the eight lower bits of this value indicate the bit number of error location

OTPMK_ZERO.description: One Time Programmable Master Key is Equal to Zero

ZMK_ZERO.description: Zeroizable Master Key is Equal to Zero

SV0.description: Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

SV1.description: Security Violation 1 security violation was detected.

SV2.description: Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

SV3.description: Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

SV4.description: Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

SV5.description: Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

SW_SV.description: Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_SV bit in the HP Command Register

SW_FSV.description: Software Fatal Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_FSV bit in the HP Command Register

SW_LPSV.description: LP Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_LPSV bit in the HP Command Register

ZMK_SYNDROME.description: Zeroizable Master Key Syndrome The ZMK syndrome indicates the single-bit error location and parity for the ZMK register

ZMK_ECC_FAIL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Failure When set, this bit triggers a bad key violation to the SSM and a security violation to the SNVS_LP section, which clears security sensitive data

LP_SEC_VIO.description: LP Security Violation A security volation was detected in the SNVS low power section.

HAC_COUNTER_IV.description: High Assurance Counter Initial Value This register is used to set the starting count value to the high assurance counter

HAC_COUNTER.description: High Assurance Counter When the HAC_EN bit is set and the SSM is in the soft fail state, this counter starts to count down with the system clock

RTC.description: HP Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the RTC
HP Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits

ZMK_WHL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

ZMK_RHL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Hard Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

SRTC_HL.description: Secure Real Time Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

LPCALB_HL.description: LP Calibration Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

MC_HL.description: Monotonic Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

GPR_HL.description: General Purpose Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

LPSVCR_HL.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

LPTDCR_HL.description: LP Tamper Detectors Configuration Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPTDCR

MKS_HL.description: Master Key Select Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LP Master Key Control Register

SRTC_ENV.description: Secure Real Time Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the SRTC becomes operational

LPTA_EN.description: LP Time Alarm Enable When set, the SNVS functional interrupt is asserted if the LP Time Alarm Register is equal to the 32 MSBs of the secure real time counter

MC_ENV.description: Monotonic Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the MC can be incremented (by write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR)

LPWUI_EN.description: LP Wake-Up Interrupt Enable This interrupt line should be connected to the external pin and is intended to inform the external chip about an SNVS_LP event (tamper event, MC rollover, SRTC rollover, or time alarm )

SRTC_INV_EN.description: If this bit is 1, in the case of a security violation the SRTC stops counting and the SRTC is invalidated (SRTC_ENV bit is cleared)

DP_EN.description: Dumb PMIC Enabled When set, software can control the system power

TOP.description: Turn off System Power Asserting this bit causes a signal to be sent to the Power Management IC to turn off the system power

PWR_GLITCH_EN.description: Power Glitch Enable By default the detection of a power glitch does not cause the pmic_en_b signal to be asserted

LPCALB_EN.description: LP Calibration Enable When set, enables the SRTC calibration mechanism

LPCALB_VAL.description: LP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for SRTC

BTN_PRESS_TIME.description: This field configures the button press time out values for the PMIC Logic

DEBOUNCE.description: This field configures the amount of debounce time for the BTN input signal

ON_TIME.description: The ON_TIME field is used to configure the period of time after BTN is asserted before pmic_en_b is asserted to turn on the SoC power

PK_EN.description: PMIC On Request Enable The value written to PK_EN will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_en

PK_OVERRIDE.description: PMIC On Request Override The value written to PK_OVERRIDE will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_override

MASTER_KEY_SEL.description: Master Key Select These bits select the SNVS Master Key output when Master Key Select bits are enabled by MKS_EN bit in the HPCOMR

ZMK_HWP.description: Zeroizable Master Key hardware Programming mode When set, only the hardware key programming mechanism can set the ZMK and software cannot read it

ZMK_VAL.description: Zeroizable Master Key Valid When set, the ZMK value can be selected by the master key control block for use by cryptographic modules

ZMK_ECC_EN.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Enable Writing one to this field automatically calculates and sets the ZMK ECC value in the ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of this register

ZMK_ECC_VALUE.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Value This field is automatically calculated and set when one is written into ZMK_ECC_EN bit of this register

SV0_EN.description: Security Violation 0 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 0 Input

SV1_EN.description: Security Violation 1 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 1 Input

SV2_EN.description: Security Violation 2 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 2 Input

SV3_EN.description: Security Violation 3 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 3 Input

SV4_EN.description: Security Violation 4 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 4 Input

SV5_EN.description: Security Violation 5 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 5 Input

SRTCR_EN.description: SRTC Rollover Enable When set, an SRTC rollover event generates an LP security violation.

MCR_EN.description: MC Rollover Enable When set, an MC Rollover event generates an LP security violation.

ET1_EN.description: External Tampering 1 Enable When set, external tampering 1 detection generates an LP security violation

ET1P.description: External Tampering 1 Polarity This bit is used to determine the polarity of external tamper 1.

PFD_OBSERV.description: System Power Fail Detector (PFD) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the inverted output of the PFD analog circuitry (external to the SNVS block)

POR_OBSERV.description: Power On Reset (POR) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the output of the POR analog circuitry (external to the SNVS

OSCB.description: Oscillator Bypass When OSCB=1 the osc_bypass signal is asserted

PGD.description: Power Supply Glitch Detected 0 No power supply glitch. 1 Power supply glitch is detected.

ESVD.description: External Security Violation Detected Indicates that a security violation is detected on one of the HP security violation ports

EO.description: Emergency Off This bit is set when a power off is requested.

SPO.description: Set Power Off The SPO bit is set when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time

LPNS.description: LP Section is Non-Secured Indicates that LP section was provisioned/programmed in the non-secure state

LPS.description: LP Section is Secured Indicates that the LP section is provisioned/programmed in the secure or trusted state

SRTC.description: LP Secure Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the SRTC
LP Secure Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits This register can be programmed only when SRTC is not active and not locked, meaning the SRTC_ENV, SRTC_SL, and SRTC_HL bits are not set

LPTA.description: LP Time Alarm This register can be programmed only when the LP time alarm is disabled (LPTA_EN bit is not set)

MON_COUNTER.description: Monotonic Counter most-significant 16 Bits The MC is incremented by one when: A write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR register is detected

MC_ERA_BITS.description: Monotonic Counter Era Bits These bits are inputs to the module and typically connect to fuses

MON_COUNTER.description: Monotonic Counter bits The MC is incremented by one when: A write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR Register is detected

GPR.description: General Purpose Register When GPR_SL or GPR_HL bit is set, the register cannot be programmed.

ZMK.description: Zeroizable Master Key Each of these registers contains 32 bits of the 256-bit ZMK value

GPR.description: General Purpose Register When GPR_SL or GPR_HL bit is set, the register cannot be programmed.
General Purpose Register When GPR_SL or GPR_HL bit is set, the register cannot be programmed.

IP_ERA.description: IP Era 00h - Era 1 or 2 03h - Era 3 04h - Era 4 05h - Era 5

PLL_SYS_NUM.description: Numerator of 528MHz System PLL Fractional Loop Divider Register

PLL_SYS_DENOM.description: Denominator of 528MHz System PLL Fractional Loop Divider Register

PLL_AUDIO_NUM.description: Numerator of Audio PLL Fractional Loop Divider Register

PLL_AUDIO_DENOM.description: Denominator of Audio PLL Fractional Loop Divider Register

PFD_480.description: 480MHz Clock (PLL3) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

PFD_480_SET.description: 480MHz Clock (PLL3) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

PFD_480_CLR.description: 480MHz Clock (PLL3) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

PFD_480_TOG.description: 480MHz Clock (PLL3) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

PFD_528.description: 528MHz Clock (PLL2) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

PFD_528_SET.description: 528MHz Clock (PLL2) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

PFD_528_CLR.description: 528MHz Clock (PLL2) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

PFD_528_TOG.description: 528MHz Clock (PLL2) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

REFTOP_PWD.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

REFTOP_VBGADJ.description: Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

REFTOP_VBGUP.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable

STOP_MODE_CONFIG.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.

DISCON_HIGH_SNVS.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

OSC_I.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

OSC_XTALOK.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

OSC_XTALOK_EN.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable

CLKGATE_CTRL.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

CLKGATE_DELAY.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

RTC_XTAL_SOURCE.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock

XTAL_24M_PWD.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true

PFD_480_AUTOGATE_EN.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_480 clocks anytime the USB1_PLL_480 is unlocked or powered off

PFD_528_AUTOGATE_EN.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_528 clocks anytime the PLL_528 is unlocked or powered off

IRQ_TEMPPANIC.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor panic interrupt asserts for a panic high temperature

IRQ_TEMPLOW.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor low interrupt asserts for low temperature

IRQ_TEMPHIGH.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor high interrupt asserts for high temperature

IRQ_ANA_BO.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the analog regulator brownout interrupts assert

IRQ_DIG_BO.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the digital regulator brownout interrupts assert

ENABLE_BO.description: Control bit to enable the brownout circuitry in the regulator.

ENABLE_PULLDOWN.description: Control bit to enable the pull-down circuitry in the regulator

OUTPUT_TRG.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator output voltage

REG0_TARG.description: This field defines the target voltage for the ARM core power domain

REG0_ADJ.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg0. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

REG1_TARG.description: This bit field defines the target voltage for the vpu/gpu power domain. Single bit increments reflect 25mV core voltage steps. Not all steps will make sense to use either because of input supply limitations or load operation.

REG1_ADJ.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg1. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

REG2_TARG.description: This field defines the target voltage for the SOC power domain

REG2_ADJ.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg2. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

FET_ODRIVE.description: If set, increases the gate drive on power gating FETs to reduce leakage in the off state

REFTOP_PWD.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

REFTOP_PWDVBGUP.description: Control bit to power down the VBG-up detection circuitry in the analog bandgap.

REFTOP_LOWPOWER.description: Control bit to enable the low-power mode in the analog bandgap.

REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

REFTOP_VBGUP.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable. 1 - Stable.

STOP_MODE_CONFIG.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.

DISCON_HIGH_SNVS.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

OSC_I.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

OSC_XTALOK.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

OSC_XTALOK_EN.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable

CLKGATE_CTRL.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

CLKGATE_DELAY.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

RTC_XTAL_SOURCE.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.

XTAL_24M_PWD.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

ENABLE_CONTEXT_SWITCHING.description: Enable automatic context switching for the channels

ENABLE_CONTEXT_CACHING.description: The software must set this bit to enable the caching of contexts between the operations

GATHER_RESIDUAL_WRITES.description: The software must set this bit to enable the ragged writes to the unaligned buffers to be gathered between multiple write operations

PRESENT_SHA.description: Indicates whether the SHA1/SHA2 functions are present.

PRESENT_CRYPTO.description: Indicates whether the crypto (cipher/hash) functions are present.

GATHER_RESIDUAL_WRITES.description: The software must set this bit to enable the ragged writes to the unaligned buffers to be gathered between multiple write operations

PRESENT_SHA.description: Indicates whether the SHA1/SHA2 functions are present.

PRESENT_CRYPTO.description: Indicates whether the crypto (cipher/hash) functions are present.

CLKGATE.description: This bit must be set to zero for a normal operation

SFTRST.description: Set this bit to zero to enable a normal DCP operation

IRQ.description: Indicates which channels have pending interrupt requests

READY_CHANNELS.description: Indicates which channels are ready to proceed with a transfer (the active channel is also included)

OTP_KEY_READY.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

OTP_KEY_READY.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

ENABLE_CHANNEL.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

CH0_IRQ_MERGED.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

NUM_KEYS.description: Encoded value indicating the number of key-storage locations implemented in the design

NUM_CHANNELS.description: Encoded value indicating the number of channels implemented in the design

DISABLE_UNIQUE_KEY.description: Write to a 1 to disable the per-device unique key

DISABLE_DECRYPT.description: Write to 1 to disable the decryption

CIPHER_ALGORITHMS.description: One-hot field indicating which cipher algorithms are available

HASH_ALGORITHMS.description: One-hot field indicating which hashing features are implemented in the hardware

INDEX.description: Key index pointer. The valid indices are 0-[number_keys].

DATA.description: Word 0 data for the key. This is the least-significant word.

INTERRUPT.description: Reflects whether the channel must issue an interrupt upon the completion of the packet.

DECR_SEMAPHORE.description: Reflects whether the channel's semaphore must be decremented at the end of the current operation

CHAIN.description: Reflects whether the next command pointer register must be loaded into the channel's current descriptor pointer

CHAIN_CONTIGUOUS.description: Reflects whether the next packet's address is located following this packet's payload.

ENABLE_MEMCOPY.description: Reflects whether the selected hashing function should be enabled for this operation.

ENABLE_CIPHER.description: Reflects whether the selected cipher function must be enabled for this operation.

ENABLE_HASH.description: Reflects whether the selected hashing function must be enabled for this operation.

ENABLE_BLIT.description: Reflects whether the DCP must perform a blit operation

CIPHER_ENCRYPT.description: When the cipher block is enabled, this bit indicates whether the operation is encryption or decryption

CIPHER_INIT.description: Reflects whether the cipher block must load the initialization vector from the payload for this operation

OTP_KEY.description: Reflects whether a hardware-based key must be used

PAYLOAD_KEY.description: When set, it indicates the payload contains the key

HASH_INIT.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the initial block in the hashing operation, so the hash registers must be initialized before the operation

HASH_TERM.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the final block in the hashing operation, so the hash padding must be applied by the hardware

CHECK_HASH.description: Reflects whether the calculated hash value must be compared to the hash provided in the payload.

HASH_OUTPUT.description: When the hashing is enabled, this bit controls whether the input or output data is hashed.

CONSTANT_FILL.description: When this bit is set (MEMCOPY and BLIT modes only), the DCP simply fills the destination buffer with the value found in the source address field

TEST_SEMA_IRQ.description: This bit is used to test the channel semaphore transition to 0. FOR TEST USE ONLY!

KEY_BYTESWAP.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key bytes (big-endian key).

KEY_WORDSWAP.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key words (big-endian key).

INPUT_BYTESWAP.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the input data (big-endian data).

INPUT_WORDSWAP.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the input data (big-endian data).

OUTPUT_BYTESWAP.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the output data (big-endian data).

OUTPUT_WORDSWAP.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the output data (big-endian data).

CIPHER_MODE.description: Cipher mode selection field. Reflects the mode of operation for the cipher operations.

CIPHER_CFG.description: Cipher configuration bits. Optional configuration bits are required for the ciphers.

COUNT.description: Byte count register. This value is the working value and updates as the operation proceeds.

ADDR.description: This regiser reflects the payload pointer for the current control packet.

VALUE.description: This read-only field shows the current (instantaneous) value of the semaphore counter.

HASH_MISMATCH.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

ERROR_SETUP.description: This bit indicates that the hardware detected an invalid programming configuration (such as a buffer length that is not a multiple of the natural data size for the operation)

ERROR_PACKET.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading the packet or payload, or when writing the status back to the packet payload

ERROR_SRC.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading from the source buffer

ERROR_DST.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when storing to the destination buffer

ERROR_PAGEFAULT.description: This bit indicates that a page fault occurred while converting a virtual address to a physical address

ERROR_CODE.description: Indicates the additional error codes for some of the error conditions

INDEX.description: Selects a value to read via the debug data register.

FLUSH.description: Page table flush control. To flush the TLB, write this bit to 1 and then back to 0.

STEP.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the stepping of the version of the design implementation.

MINOR.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MINOR version of the design implementation.

MAJOR.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MAJOR version of the design implementation.

IMR1.description: IRQ[31:0] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

IMR2.description: IRQ[63:32] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

IMR3.description: IRQ[95:64] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

IMR4.description: IRQ[127:96] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

IMR5.description: IRQ[159:128] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

MEGA_PUPSCR.description: PGC Mega Power Up Sequence Control Register

MEGA_PDNSCR.description: PGC Mega Pull Down Sequence Control Register

MEGA_SR.description: PGC Mega Power Gating Controller Status Register

CPU_PUPSCR.description: PGC CPU Power Up Sequence Control Register

CPU_PDNSCR.description: PGC CPU Pull Down Sequence Control Register

CPU_SR.description: PGC CPU Power Gating Controller Status Register

PCR.description: Power Control PCR must not change from power-down request (pdn_req) assertion until the target subsystem is completely powered up

SW.description: After a power-up request (pup_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of SW before asserting power toggle on/off signal (switch_b)

SW2ISO.description: After asserting power toggle on/off signal (switch_b), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of SW2ISO before negating isolation

ISO.description: After a power-down request (pdn_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of ISO before asserting isolation

ISO2SW.description: After asserting isolation, the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of ISO2SW before negating power toggle on/off signal (switch_b)

PCR.description: Power Control PCR must not change from power-down request (pdn_req) assertion until the target subsystem is completely powered up

SW.description: There are two different silicon revisions: 1

SW2ISO.description: There are two different silicon revisions: 1

ISO.description: After a power-down request (pdn_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of 32k clocks equal to the value of ISO before asserting isolation

ISO2SW.description: After asserting isolation, the PGC waits a number of 32k clocks equal to the value of ISO2SW before negating

core0_dbg_rst.description: Software reset for core0 debug only

dbg_rst_msk_pg.description: Do not assert debug resets after power gating event of core

ipp_reset_b.description: Indicates whether reset was the result of ipp_reset_b pin (Power-up sequence)

lockup.description: Indicates a reset has been caused by CPU lockup.

csu_reset_b.description: Indicates whether the reset was the result of the csu_reset_b input.

ipp_user_reset_b.description: Indicates whether the reset was the result of the ipp_user_reset_b qualified reset.

jtag_rst_b.description: HIGH - Z JTAG reset. Indicates whether the reset was the result of HIGH-Z reset from JTAG.

SEC_CONFIG.description: SECONFIG[1] shows the state of the SECONFIG[1] fuse

DIR_BT_DIS.description: DIR_BT_DIS shows the state of the DIR_BT_DIS fuse

BT_FUSE_SEL.description: BT_FUSE_SEL (connected to gpio bt_fuse_sel) shows the state of the BT_FUSE_SEL fuse

BMOD.description: BMOD[1:0] shows the latched state of the BOOT_MODE1 and BOOT_MODE0 signals on the rising edge of POR_B

PERSISTENT_ENTRY0.description: Holds entry function for core0 for waking-up from low power mode

PERSISTENT_ARG0.description: Holds argument of entry function for core0 for waking-up from low power mode

PERSIST_REDUNDANT_BOOT.description: This field identifies which image must be used - 0/1/2/3

PERSIST_SECONDARY_BOOT.description: This bit identifies which image must be used - primary and secondary

DATAX.description: Data Fix Registers - Stores the data used for 1-word data fix operations

DATAFIX.description: Data Fix Enable - Controls the use of the first 8 address comparators for 1-word data fix or for code patch routine

DIS.description: ROMC Disable -- This bit, when set, disables all ROMC operations

ENABLE.description: Enable Address Comparator - This bit enables the corresponding address comparator to trigger an event

THUMBX.description: THUMB Comparator Select - Indicates that this address will trigger a THUMB opcode patch or an Arm opcode patch

ADDRX.description: Address Comparator Registers - Indicates the memory address to be watched

SOURCE.description: ROMC Source Number - Binary encoding of the number of the address comparator which has an address match in the most recent patch event on ROMC AHB

SW.description: ROMC AHB Multiple Address Comparator matches Indicator - Indicates that multiple address comparator matches occurred

RXEDGIE.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

RXEDGIF.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

TXDIR.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

URxFul.description: U Channel receive register full, can't be cleared with reg

BitErr.description: SPDIF receiver found parity bit error

CNew.description: SPDIF receive change in value of control channel

RxFIFOFul.description: SPDIF Rx FIFO full, can't be cleared with reg. IntClear. To clear it, read from Rx FIFO.

TxEm.description: SPDIF Tx FIFO empty, can't be cleared with reg. IntClear. To clear it, write toTx FIFO.

QRxFul.description: Q Channel receive register full, can't be cleared with reg

URxFul.description: U Channel receive register full, can't be cleared with reg

BitErr.description: SPDIF receiver found parity bit error

CNew.description: SPDIF receive change in value of control channel

RxCChannel_h.description: SPDIF receive C channel register, contains first 24 bits of C channel without interpretation

RxCChannel_l.description: SPDIF receive C channel register, contains next 24 bits of C channel without interpretation

RxUChannel.description: SPDIF receive U channel register, contains next 3 U channel bytes

RxQChannel.description: SPDIF receive Q channel register, contains next 3 Q channel bytes

TxDataLeft.description: SPDIF transmit left channel data. It is write-only, and always returns zeros when read

TxDataRight.description: SPDIF transmit right channel data. It is write-only, and always returns zeros when read

tx_all_clk_en.description: Spdif transfer clock enable. When data is going to be transfered, this bit should be set to1.

EN_24M.description: Enable 24 MHz clock input from crystal

IM2.description: IM2 (bits 19-18, Input Capture Channel 2 operating mode) IM1 (bits 17-16, Input Capture Channel 1 operating mode) The IMn bit field determines the transition on the input pin (for Input capture channel n), which will trigger a capture event

OM3.description: OM3 (bits 28-26) controls the Output Compare Channel 3 operating mode

FO3.description: FO3 Force Output Compare Channel 3 FO2 Force Output Compare Channel 2 FO1 Force Output Compare Channel 1 The FOn bit causes the pin action programmed for the timer Output Compare n pin (according to the OMn bits in this register)

OF3.description: OF3 Output Compare 3 Flag OF2 Output Compare 2 Flag OF1 Output Compare 1 Flag The OFn bit indicates that a compare event has occurred on Output Compare channel n

IF2.description: IF2 Input capture 2 Flag IF1 Input capture 1 Flag The IFn bit indicates that a capture event has occurred on Input Capture channel n

OF3IE.description: OF3IE Output Compare 3 Interrupt Enable OF2IE Output Compare 2 Interrupt Enable OF1IE Output Compare 1 Interrupt Enable The OFnIE bit controls the Output Compare Channel n interrupt

IF2IE.description: IF2IE Input capture 2 Interrupt Enable IF1IE Input capture 1 Interrupt Enable The IFnIE bit controls the IFnIE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable

ROVIE.description: Rollover Interrupt Enable. The ROVIE bit controls the Rollover interrupt.

COUNT.description: Counter Value. The COUNT bits show the current count value of the GPT counter.

AIRCR.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

SHCSR.description: System Handler Control and State Register

STIR.description: Instruction cache invalidate all to Point of Unification (PoU)

ICIALLU.description: Instruction cache invalidate all to Point of Unification (PoU)

ICIMVAU.description: Instruction cache invalidate by address to PoU

DCIMVAC.description: Data cache invalidate by address to Point of Coherency (PoC)

DCCMVAU.description: Data cache by address to PoU

DCCMVAC.description: Data cache clean by address to PoC

DCCIMVAC.description: Data cache clean and invalidate by address to PoC

DCCISW.description: Data cache clean and invalidate by set/way

DISRAMODE.description: Disables dynamic read allocate mode for Write-Back Write-Allocate memory regions.

DISITMATBFLUSH.description: Disables ITM and DWT ATB flush.

DISDYNADD.description: Disables dynamic allocation of ADD and SUB instructions

RETTOBASE.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

VECTPENDING.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

ISRPENDING.description: Interrupt pending flag, excluding NMI and Faults

VECTRESET.description: Writing 1 to this bit causes a local system reset

VECTCLRACTIVE.description: Writing 1 to this bit clears all active state information for fixed and configurable exceptions.

PRIGROUP.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

SLEEPONEXIT.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

SLEEPDEEP.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

NONBASETHRDENA.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

USERSETMPEND.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

DIV_0_TRP.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BFHFNMIGN.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

STKALIGN.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BP.description: Always reads-as-one. It indicates branch prediction is enabled.

PRI_15.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

MUNSTKERR.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

MSTKERR.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

MLSPERR.description: MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

MMARVALID.description: MemManage Fault Address Register (MMFAR) valid flag

UNSTKERR.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

STKERR.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

LSPERR.description: Bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

INVPC.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, caused by an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

VECTTBL.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vector table read during exception processing.

FORCED.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handles, either because of priority or because it is disabled.

DEBUGEVT.description: Reserved for Debug use. When writing to the register you must write 0 to this bit, otherwise behavior is Unpredictable.

HALTED.description: Indicates a debug event generated by either a C_HALT or C_STEP request, triggered by a write to the DHCSR or a step request triggered by setting DEMCR.MON_STEP to 1.

BKPT.description: Debug event generated by BKPT instruction execution or a breakpoint match in FPB

DWTTRAP.description: Debug event generated by the DWT

VCATCH.description: Indicates triggering of a Vector catch

EXTERNAL.description: Debug event generated because of the assertion of an external debug request

DEBUGMODEL.description: Support for memory-mapped debug model for M profile processors

IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED0.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED1.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED2.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED3.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

OUTERMOST_SHAREABILITY.description: Indicates the outermost shareability domain implemented

SHAREABILITY_LEVELS.description: Indicates the number of shareability levels implemented

TCM_SUPPORT.description: Indicates the support for Tightly Coupled Memory

AUXILIARY_REGISTERS.description: Indicates the support for Auxiliary registers

ID_MMFR1.description: Gives information about the implemented memory model and memory management support.

WFI_STALL.description: Indicates the support for Wait For Interrupt (WFI) stalling

ID_MMFR3.description: Gives information about the implemented memory model and memory management support.

BITCOUNT_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported Bit Counting instructions

CMPBRANCH_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported combined Compare and Branch instructions

IMMEDIATE_INSTRS.description: Indicates the support for data-processing instructions with long immediate

LOADSTORE_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported additional load and store instructions

MEMHINT_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported Memory Hint instructions

MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS.description: Indicates the support for multi-access interruptible instructions

MULT_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported additional Multiply instructions

MULTS_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported advanced signed Multiply instructions

MULTU_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported advanced unsigned Multiply instructions

SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS.description: Together with the ID_ISAR4[SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS_FRAC] indicates the supported Synchronization Primitives

TABBRANCH_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported Table Branch instructions

THUMBCOPY_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported non flag-setting MOV instructions

TRUENOP_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported non flag-setting MOV instructions

UNPRIV_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported unprivileged instructions. These are the instruction variants indicated by a T suffix.

WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS.description: Indicates the support for instructions with shifts

WRITEBACK_INSTRS.description: Indicates the support for Writeback addressing modes

SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS_FRAC.description: Together with the ID_ISAR3[SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS] indicates the supported Synchronization Primitives

PSR_M_INSTRS.description: Indicates the supported M profile instructions to modify the PSRs

CL1.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 1.

CL2.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 2.

CL3.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 3.

CL4.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 4.

CL5.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 5.

CL6.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 6.

CL7.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 7.

LOUIS.description: Level of Unification Inner Shareable for the cache hierarchy. This field is RAZ.

LOC.description: Level of Coherency for the cache hierarchy

LOU.description: Level of Unification for the cache hierarchy

IMINLINE.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the instruction caches that are controlled by the processor.

DMINLINE.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the data caches and unified caches that are controlled by the processor.

ERG.description: Exclusives Reservation Granule. The maximum size of the reservation granule that has been implemented for the Load-Exclusive and Store-Exclusive instructions, encoded as Log2 of the number of words.

CWG.description: Cache Write-back Granule. The maximum size of memory that can be overwritten as a result of the eviction of a cache entry that has had a memory location in it modified, encoded as Log2 of the number of words.

ASSOCIATIVITY.description: (Associativity of cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates an associativity of 1. The associativity does not have to be a power of 2.

NUMSETS.description: (Number of sets in cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates 1 set in the cache. The number of sets does not have to be a power of 2.

WA.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-allocation

RA.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports read-allocation

WB.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-back

WT.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-through

INTID.description: Indicates the interrupt to be triggered

ICIMVAU.description: I-cache invalidate by MVA to PoU

DCIMVAC.description: D-cache invalidate by MVA to PoC

DCCMVAU.description: D-cache clean by MVA to PoU

DCCMVAC.description: D-cache clean by MVA to PoC

DCCIMVAC.description: D-cache clean and invalidate by MVA to PoC

DCCISW.description: D-cache clean and invalidate by set-way

EN.description: TCM enable. When a TCM is disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.

RMW.description: Read-Modify-Write (RMW) enable. Indicates that all writes to TCM, that are not the full width of the TCM RAM, use a RMW sequence.

RETEN.description: Retry phase enable. When enabled the processor guarantees to honor the retry output on the corresponding TCM interface, re-executing the instruction which carried out the TCM access.

SZ.description: TCM size. Indicates the size of the relevant TCM.

EN.description: TCM enable. When a TCM is disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.

RMW.description: Read-Modify-Write (RMW) enable. Indicates that all writes to TCM, that are not the full width of the TCM RAM, use a RMW sequence.

RETEN.description: Retry phase enable. When enabled the processor guarantees to honor the retry output on the corresponding TCM interface, re-executing the instruction which carried out the TCM access.

SZ.description: TCM size. Indicates the size of the relevant TCM.

SIWT.description: Shared cacheable-is-WT for data cache. Enables limited cache coherency usage.

ECCDIS.description: Enables ECC in the instruction and data cache.

FORCEWT.description: Enables Force Write-Through in the data cache.

TPRI.description: Threshold execution priority for AHBS traffic demotion.

AXIMTYPE.description: Indicates the type of fault on the AXIM interface. Only valid when AXIM is 1.

INTID.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-239. For example, a value of 0x03 specifies interrupt IRQ3.
